raw: * This is a basic form field with common functionality for
* {@link TextArea} and {@link TextField}.
* On every keystroke the value is synchronized with the
* value of the textfield. Value changes can be monitored by listening to the
* {@link #input} or {@link #changeValue} events, respectively.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: This is a basic form field with common functionality for {@link TextArea} and {@link TextField}. On every keystroke the value is synchronized with the value of the textfield. Value changes can be monitored by listening to the {@link #input} or {@link #changeValue} events, respectively.

raw: * Adds the CSS rules needed to style the native placeholder element.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Adds the CSS rules needed to style the native placeholder element.

raw: * The event is fired on every keystroke modifying the value of the field.
* The method {@link qx.event.type.Data#getData} returns the
* current value of the text field.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The event is fired on every keystroke modifying the value of the field. The method {@link qx.event.type.Data#getData} returns the current value of the text field.

raw: * The event is fired each time the text field looses focus and the
* text field values has changed.
* If you change {@link #liveUpdate} to true, the changeValue event will
* be fired after every keystroke and not only after every focus loss. In
* that mode, the changeValue event is equal to the {@link #input} event.
* The method {@link qx.event.type.Data#getData} returns the
* current text value of the field.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The event is fired each time the text field looses focus and the text field values has changed. If you change {@link #liveUpdate} to true, the changeValue event will be fired after every keystroke and not only after every focus loss. In that mode, the changeValue event is equal to the {@link #input} event. The method {@link qx.event.type.Data#getData} returns the current text value of the field.

raw: * Alignment of the text

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Alignment of the text

raw: * Whether the field is read only

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Whether the field is read only

raw: overridden
overridden
* Maximal number of characters that can be entered in the TextArea.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Maximal number of characters that can be entered in the TextArea.

raw: * Whether the {@link #changeValue} event should be fired on every key
* input. If set to true, the changeValue event is equal to the
* {@link #input} event.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Whether the {@link #changeValue} event should be fired on every key input. If set to true, the changeValue event is equal to the {@link #input} event.

raw: * Fire a {@link #changeValue} event whenever the content of the
* field matches the given regular expression. Accepts both regular
* expression objects as well as strings for input.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Fire a {@link #changeValue} event whenever the content of the field matches the given regular expression. Accepts both regular expression objects as well as strings for input.

raw: * String value which will be shown as a hint if the field is all of:
* unset, unfocused and enabled. Set to null to not show a placeholder
* text.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: String value which will be shown as a hint if the field is all of: unset, unfocused and enabled. Set to null to not show a placeholder text.

raw: * RegExp responsible for filtering the value of the textfield. the RegExp
* gives the range of valid values.
* Note: The regexp specified is applied to each character in turn,
* NOT to the entire string. So only regular expressions matching a
* single character make sense in the context.
* The following example only allows digits in the textfield.

* 
field.setFilter(/[0-9]/);

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
RegExp responsible for filtering the value of the textfield. the RegExp gives the range of valid values. Note: The regexp specified is applied to each character in turn, NOT to the entire string. So only regular expressions matching a single character make sense in the context. The following example only allows digits in the textfield. 

field.setFilter(/[0-9]/);

raw: * Flag signaling if a widget is valid. If a widget is invalid, an invalid
* state will be set.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Flag signaling if a widget is valid. If a widget is invalid, an invalid state will be set.

raw: * Flag signaling if a widget is required.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Flag signaling if a widget is required.

raw: * Message which will be shown in an tooltip if the widget is invalid.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Message which will be shown in an tooltip if the widget is invalid.

raw: * Message which will be shown in an invalid tooltip if the {@link #required} is
* set to true.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Message which will be shown in an invalid tooltip if the {@link #required} is set to true.

* method, to create different input elements.
* @return {qx.html.Input} a new input element.

@description.body: Creates the input element. Derived classes may override this method, to create different input elements.

raw: * Set the selection to the given start and end (zero-based).
* If no end value is given the selection will extend to the
* end of the textfield's content.
* This method only works if the widget is already created and
* added to the document.
* @param start {Integer} start of the selection (zero-based)
* @param end {Integer} end of the selection

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Set the selection to the given start and end (zero-based). If no end value is given the selection will extend to the end of the textfield's content. This method only works if the widget is already created and added to the document.

raw: * Clears the current selection.
